MC:
A security system has two inputs. The first input is X, a 'window open' signal which is 1 if a window is open and 0 if it's closed. The second input is Y, a 'motion detected' signal that is 1 if motion is detected and 0 otherwise.

Choose a system above whose output F will be '1' when both the window is open and there is motion detected.

A security system has two inputs. The first input is X, a 'window open' signal which is 1 if a window is open and 0 if it's closed. The second input is Y, a 'motion detected' signal that is 1 if motion is detected and 0 otherwise.

Choose a system above whose output F will be '1' when either the window is open or there is motion detected (or both).

A security system has two inputs. The first input is X, a 'window open' signal which is 1 if a window is open and 0 if it's closed. The second input is Y, a 'motion detected' signal that is 1 if motion is detected and 0 otherwise.

Choose a system above whose output F will be '0' when both the window is open and there is motion detected.

A security system has two inputs. The first input is X, a 'window open' signal which is 1 if a window is open and 0 if it's closed. The second input is Y, a 'motion detected' signal that is 1 if motion is detected and 0 otherwise.

Choose a system above whose output F will be '1' only when the window is closed and no motion is detected.
